* `BeamRecord`
* `BeamRecordCoder`
* `BeamSqlRecordType` extends `BeamRecordType`

and BeamSqlRecordHelper to handle the type cast, coder in SQL.

Let's finish this first, then I'll move on to the windowInfo fields;

> ```Java
>  * Options that configure the Tez pipeline.
>  */
> public interface TezPipelineOptions extends PipelineOptions, java.io.Serializable {
> ```

I think PipelineOptions cannot be Serializable.

Other runners uses a separate class SerializablePipelineOptions when translating.

*[runners/tez/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/tez/translation/GroupByKeyTranslator.java, line 21 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/3677#-Kqh4sg68-SD4_VhNkYL:-Kqh4sg68-SD4_VhNkYM:bes87v2) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/346274d62540a16c9bf795fc6e9ab2cd28430008/runners/tez/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/tez/translation/GroupByKeyTranslator.java#L21)):*

I ended up removing the common module in favor of having every example self-contained. After reviewing for best practices in code samples, we discussed the following options:

1) Having each example completely self contained in one file
2) Having a "common" package and make this the standard way of including new files

Here's Jon Wayne's response:

> Go with (1) with a separate sample for how to include custom packages. Code duplication is actually not a bad thing in samples, it re-enforces learning.
> 
> You can read about about my philosophy on samples https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/python-docs-samples/blob/master/AUTHORING_GUIDE.md#the-sample-format

The ``juliaset`` sample already demonstrates how to create a custom import package.
Thanks for the review, @charlesccychen ! Addressed your comments. PTAL.

@lukecwik Many thanks to have taken some of your time for reviewing my work before your holidays.
I am going to make a commit with the style fixes for all classes (even T-Digest). I hope I missed nothing.
For the type issues, I saw your remarks and will work on this next week.

For package flattening, I think you're right. The current organization comes from my work on DQ-Talend where there are more classes inside the packages so now this makes sense to flatten them.
Anything I can do to help get this pull request submitted? My team is relying on this fix for our project. Not sure if I missed a step in the submission process.
